sentences.english: When the inebriated elk was freed, it lay for a while on the ground, seemingly unconscious.
sentences.chinese: 当“醉鬼”获救后，它在地上躺了一会，昏迷不醒。

sentences.english: After the fierce fighting, the boy was saved safely.
sentences.chinese: 在激战后，男孩安全获救了。

sentences.english: China extends its congratulations and wishes them early recovery of health.
sentences.chinese: 中方对此表示祝贺，并祝愿获救矿工早日恢复健康。

sentences.english: The scarlet cord was a sign to the spies she wanted to be rescued by them.
sentences.chinese: 朱红线绳是给探子们的暗号，告诉他们她想获救。

sentences.english: The passengers of that highjacked airplane were rescued.
sentences.chinese: 那架被劫持的飞机上面的乘客都已获救。

sentences.english: This British intervention may have helped save her.
sentences.chinese: 英方的这次介入可以有助于她的获救。

sentences.english: The amount of reward shall not exceed the value of the vessel and other property salved.
sentences.chinese: 救助报酬金额不得超过船舶和其他财产的获救价值。

sentences.english: Rescue their bodies from the poisoned sun.
sentences.chinese: 从毒辣的太阳下面获救。

sentences.english: Rescued the crew was on the 23rd arrived in Hanoi Noi Bai International Airport.
sentences.chinese: 获救船员已于23日抵达河内内排国际机场。

sentences.english: If it should rain tomorrow, the crops would be saved.
sentences.chinese: 要是来日诰日下雨，庄稼就获救了。

sentences.english: Stone success led the main body, majia team rescued.
sentences.chinese: 石头成功引开主力部队，运粮队获救。

sentences.english: It's lucky that you're saved by the bell but you won't escape next time.
sentences.chinese: 这次你能幸运获救，下次不会让你逃掉了。

sentences.english: From there he plans to escape together with Kyra, who first has to be rescued.
sentences.chinese: 他计划从那里逃出连同凯拉塞，谁首先要获救。

sentences.english: They lost only one man on the journey and were eventually rescued.
sentences.chinese: 在这次旅途中他们只丢失了一个人并最后获救。

sentences.english: The vessel sank about 10 minutes after the crew was transferred to the rescue boats.
sentences.chinese: 当获救船员登上救援船10分钟后，起火船只沉没。

sentences.english: Yet, when Ben-Hur saved his life, he became a staunch and grateful friend.
sentences.chinese: 但在获救之后，他心怀谢意，成了宾虚忠实的朋友。

definition: to escape (danger)/to rescue/to come out alive
to fall into water/to sink/overboard/fig. to degenerate/to sink (into depravity)/to go to the dogs
to get into difficulties/to meet with danger
to rescue/to help out of difficulties/to save the situation
to send or deliver to the hospital
to provide critical care (to a patient or a diseased plant)
